This is about more than “lake levels.” It’s a fight for the health of millions in FL. It’s a fight to prevent toxic discharges & restore the Everglades. U.S. Sugar doesn’t care about that - they just want to hoard the water, consequences be damned.  
https://t.co/3u6TOauhya

Coronavirus has resulted in the hardest working people being asked something never before seen: don’t go to work. My goal is to turn that around & find every job out there to fill w/ someone looking for work! Starting right now w/ our new virtual job fair:
https://t.co/DzeXL4gK7K

75 years ago, the Nazis surrendered to the Allied Powers in Europe, ending WWII. Today we honor those who answered the call to service & salute their sacrifices for our freedom. These men & women changed the course of history by proving that good will always triumph over evil! https://t.co/YRM0hj0wS0

Today is #NationalNursesDay.  I hope we can all give a HUGE thank you to every one of the nurses out there on the front line of the coronavirus battle! Each day you put it all on the line to protect our families and community. We appreciate all that you do. https://t.co/iL9pVkTwoR

Veterans deserve better than a broken claims system that makes them wait more than a year to receive the pension they’ve earned. I’m working with a bipartisan group of lawmakers to fix these incessant delays and fix this broken system! Read more:
https://t.co/zMjhhExaJg

On this #TeacherAppreciationDay, I want to say THANK YOU to all of the dedicated men and women preparing the next generation to lead the world. Your commitment to our children during this time of distance learning does not go unnoticed! https://t.co/d1rKK5sK5d

(1/2) The current claims process for VA Pensions and Survivors Pensions simply does not work. Veterans and their families - men and women who have sacrificed everything for our nation - are left waiting for months with little to no communication on the status of their claim.

Since passing additional funding, more than 185,000 Paycheck Protection Program loans for more than $12.2 billion have been approved in Florida to help keep employees on payroll. More than 70% of the loans nationwide have been for less than $50,000. https://t.co/qnUGrvi6BE

Did you see this? → Local officials in Palm Beach, Martin & St. Lucie Counties have issued updated guidance following @GovRonDeSantis announcement of new policies going into place tomorrow. Learn more about these updates & sign up to receive alerts here:
https://t.co/yzOGatN1tU

Many businesses that have been severely impacted by coronavirus will qualify for two new employer tax credits put into place by Congress – the Credit for Sick and Family Leave and the Employee Retention Credit.  Learn more here:
https://t.co/pvPNd79K4P

Important information for veterans pension beneficiaries who are still waiting to receive their economic impact payment. If you have questions, please don’t hesitate to call our office at 202-225-3026! https://t.co/KOKmBMVuQ7

The US must hold China accountable for their total failure & deception in managing this outbreak that has taken so many American lives, cost so many jobs & caused so many businesses to close! I introduced a bill to make China pay for all costs incurred because of their duplicity: https://t.co/ISgoK2opx3

(1/2) I know it can seem obtuse when Congress talks about passing billions of dollars in relief while people are struggling to get onto a website to file for unemployment. I also know politicians are rarely helpful in making it clear how you can actually get the money you need.

If you are still waiting on your economic impact payment please read this important new information from the IRS, including a new deadline for SSI and Veterans Benefit recipients to claim dependent children:
https://t.co/9dWiKsSId0

Palm Beach County Youth Services will be distributing meals to children impacted by the coronavirus next week. Meals will be available at various locations. More information about the program can be found here:
https://t.co/BvYyjqpKq7

https://t.co/2iRfSNgIUU

The House of Representatives is finally in session to vote on small business funding, more PPE distribution and increased testing. This is absolutely critical! Congress needs to skip the partisan gridlock and do our jobs with the urgency this crisis deserves! https://t.co/aFEeUFbjYA
The @IRSnews has now postponed this event.  I will update if/when it is rescheduled. https://t.co/YiI7qNIcvI

I’ve compiled a list of important coronavirus information for families, seniors, veterans, business owners and more. Read more here and please do not hesitate to call at 202-225-3026 if you have any questions:
https://t.co/yzOGatN1tU
The IRS is hosting a webinar tomorrow with a live Q&A session to answer questions about the economic assistance that is available.  Learn more here: https://t.co/EteqqxU4tE

(1/2) Please note: if you receive social security - including retirement, disability and survivor benefit recipients – and have a dependent child who you have not claimed because you did not file a tax return in 2018 or 2019, you must use the IRS Non-Filer Tool by 12 p.m.

This is the email that we got this morning. 

If the Senate is voting today why would the House wait until THURSDAY?  How many jobs will be lost while we wait? How many businesses forced to close?

Reps should be here now! Not waiting to be told to do their job by @SpeakerPelosi. https://t.co/OgBn698a8d

I'm at the Capitol today.  Most Members of Congress are not.  That's a serious problem. Every hour we don't vote means more businesses closing & more people losing jobs. 

I will keep fighting to get the other 534 Members of Congress to realize this urgency before its too late! https://t.co/kWvEdxXy1y
The House of Representatives is basically empty - in the moment when families, individuals and small businesses need support the most. There is no debate, no votes, nothing. https://t.co/udR4GLOt14
China’s total lack of transparency and mishandling of the coronavirus outbreak has cost tens of thousands of lives, millions of jobs and left untold economic destruction.

Nearly 89,000 PPP loans for more than $17.8 billion have been approved in FL to help keep employees on payroll, but there are still so many small businesses that need this support and haven’t gotten it yet. That’s why I’m fighting for additional funding for this program ASAP!

It’s been clear for well over a week now that the Paycheck Protection Program small business loan program would need additional funding.  The fact that the House of Representatives doesn’t plan to vote until Wednesday at the earliest is a complete disgrace.
I joined @WPTV #ToThePoint this morning to discuss why Congress needs to get back to work ASAP to pass funding for small businesses.  Watch here: https://t.co/EVE5ee6IyP
What should you do if you’re feeling sick?  Here’s another video highlighting #FactsNotFear: https://t.co/k0SmWBTlm2

.@SpeakerPelosi I hear you like ice cream. So do I. 

Open up the House of Representatives so we can 𝗩𝗢𝗧𝗘 𝗢𝗡 𝗦𝗠𝗔𝗟𝗟 𝗕𝗨𝗦𝗜𝗡𝗘𝗦𝗦 𝗙𝗨𝗡𝗗𝗜𝗡𝗚 and I will buy ice cream for you AND your staff!

DO YOUR DAMN JOB! https://t.co/W8YJnx3T0x

I have great news!  After several weeks of working to convince the IRS to streamline the process for individuals to receive their stimulus checks, the IRS has made the process much easier for veterans who don’t typically file taxes!
The guidelines issued by the @CDCgov and @WhiteHouse are about #FactsNotFear.  Watch more here: https://t.co/OLfxFdpqSB

This is COWARDLY "leadership." @SpeakerPelosi do your damn job and bring the House of Representatives into session so the other 434 Members of Congress can do theirs also.  Stop negotiating behind closed doors without anybody else and let's let the American people SEE THE DEBATE! https://t.co/R5UCMjebEG

As you may know, the IRS has launched a new tool this week for you to check the status of your economic impact payment.  The tool has told many people that the IRS is unable to determine the status of your payment, so I’ve been working with the IRS to get this sorted out...(1/2)

What will members of Congress have to say after the great pandemic of 2020? We’re we in Washington busting our tails make sure PPP is funded when America needed us or did @SpeakerPelosi have us home shoveling dung?@realDonaldTrump @RepPaulMitchell @RepMattGaetz @RepMichaelWaltz https://t.co/3lE5jc8EXf

Good news: @GovRonDeSantis has suspended the biweekly “actively seeking work” reporting requirement for individuals receiving unemployment insurance. Cutting this red tape will ensure you don’t have to fight with the system every 2 weeks to keep your benefits during the pandemic. https://t.co/rVT445m2MY

I have never been more embarrassed in my life than @SpeakerPelosi having us members of Congress home, not working even as PPP loans predictably ran out of $$. @realDonaldTrump push her to show some American grit like our first responders/nurses/doctors. #getCongressToWork

Like so many in our community, fishermen are feeling the negative economic impact of the coronavirus. I fought hard to secure funding for our fishing industry in the CARES Act & now I’m urging Secretary Ross to ensure this support gets to those who need it most! Read our letter: https://t.co/H9XP4Y5Pg2

After several weeks of working to convince the IRS to streamline the process for individuals to receive their stimulus checks, the IRS has made the process easier for Supplemental Security Income (SSI) recipients who don’t typically file taxes! Learn more:
https://t.co/DNq5UzOFsp

The long wait times & unsatisfactory answers by the SBA are unacceptable! Businesses in our community cannot wait another day for loans that could help them keep their doors open. I'm continuing to press them to improve & speed up the approval process!
https://t.co/JRRJ2sv9Zq
Good news: at my urging, individuals receiving Supplemental Security Income (SSI) will now get economic impact payments without having to take any further action.

I spoke with @GovRonDeSantis today about the failures with unemployment. He has appointed a new leader to oversee coronavirus unemployment response & committed to working with me to make sure it works. The fight continues - please do not hesitate to reach out at 202-225-3026! https://t.co/wuuMtpcaVL

Since passing the CARES Act, more than 52,000 Paycheck Protection Program loans for more than $12.6 billion have been approved in Florida to help keep employees on payroll. If there is anything I can do to help, please don’t hesitate to reach out at 202-225-3026! https://t.co/ZsTgi5FfIp

Due to the coronavirus, @POTUS has extended the deadline to file federal taxes (which would normally be today) to July 15 w/ no penalty. The IRS has also just launched a new tool for you to check the status of your economic impact payment. Learn more here: https://t.co/o5o4iBguuG

I spoke with @foxandfriends this morning from my kitchen because Speaker Pelosi is refusing to bring the House of Representatives into session to debate and vote on improvements to the coronavirus response.  There is work to do and a mission to accomplish.
.@IRSnews has just launched their new tool so you can check the status of your economic impact payment and add your direct deposit information if needed. It's available here: https://t.co/pjBLatlOsP

THREAD: At a time of unprecedented crisis for our nation, Speaker Pelosi has kept Congress out of session — not even debating new ways to help Americans — for weeks.  She just announced she won’t re-open the House until at least May 4th…

 https://t.co/igPQHZy6gt

https://t.co/hf6OOPckMa

For the vast majority of Americans, no action is required to receive your stimulus check & direct deposits will begin next week; however, for those who don't normally file a tax return, the IRS just launched a new web tool allowing quick registration for Economic Impact Payments.

As a result of legislation passed by Congress, the Department of Health and Human Services is sending more than $4.5 million to health centers in Palm Beach County this week. These funds will be used to detect, prevent and treat the coronavirus!
https://t.co/Y7Ug4p7pig

With this week being Public Health Week, I wanted to pause for a second to give a HUGE thank you to all of the doctors, nurses, first responders and volunteers who continue to combat the coronavirus on the front lines. You are all heroes and our community is grateful! https://t.co/yHdbC3lM4V

Wishing the #FL18 Jewish community a happy and peaceful Passover— Chag Sameach! https://t.co/rVt5Q7gZws

St. Lucie County officials have announced an order implementing a “Safer At Home” policy for residents beginning April 4 at 6am. Individuals should leave their homes only to perform essential work duties or pick up groceries and medication. Read the order: https://t.co/rt0t9Yp5he https://t.co/cfYIIb5jOz

For updated information on which businesses are eligible & how to apply, please read this important update: https://t.co/1IvuXR7idB

LINK: https://t.co/BJUmPkt1T7

All public school closures in Martin & St. Lucie Counties have been extended through May 1. Public schools in Palm Beach County are closed until further notice.
